title: Lucky escape for girl cocooned inside 'deadly sleeping bag' after lamp fell and set her bed on fire
text:
News Lucky escape for girl cocooned inside 'deadly sleeping bag' after lamp fell and set her bed on fire Brooque-Rae Whewell, 6, was sleeping soundly at her home in the early hours of Saturday morning when she became aware of a burning sensation on her legs Share Brooque-Rae Whewell has had a lucky escape after being cocooned inside her sleeping bag after her halogen lamp fell over and ignited (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Share Get daily   
A young girl has miraculously survived after she became cocooned inside a melting blanket after a lamp fell on to her bed. 
Brooque-Rae Whewell, 6, was sleeping soundly at her home at 4.30am on Saturday morning when she became aware of a burning sensation on her legs. 
A halogen desk lamp, which was turned off by mum Adele and dad Matt before they went to bed, had fallen off the side – inadvertently flicking the switch and turning on the bulb. 
The light began to heat up which Matt says melted the blankets and fused around er, creating a “deadly sleeping bag”. The hole melted into the bed (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
The couple now want to warn other parents of the dangers after the incident at their home in Bootle, The Liverpool Echo reports. 
The 27-year-old said: “She awoke to a burning feeling on her leg to then realise her bed was on fire and she was trapped inside a dripping mess that was her blanket.” 
The quick-thinking youngster was unable to reach the plug but grabbed her stuffed bunny rabbit, Ted, and pushed it against the plug to switch off her reading light. Read More Naked artist lies in bath full of broken glass in bizarre two hour-long performance Adele Callear with her partner Matt Whewell and their children Brooque-Rae and Lucus-Jo (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
Mum-of-two Adele, also 27, added: “We were in bed, Matt had a bad day at work so wasn’t sleeping well. 
“He woke up to the smell of burning plastic and ran into Brooque’s room. 
“She was sat bolt upright in bed, the blanket was cocooned round her legs and stuck to the mattress. She couldn’t get out.” 
Matt then pulled his daughter away from the “smouldering mess” but the family did not need to call firefighters. 
The relieved dad said it was a “miracle” he was woken by the smell. 
Brooque-Rae was left shaken but escaped virtually unharmed apart from a small burn on her foot. 
Adele said: “I don’t understand why the lamp could get so close to being on fire but didn’t trip in the plug or socket despite the heat. The burnt bed (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Read More Tragic cyclist breaks his leg while riding his bike and dies four days later 
“The whole glass light melted itself to the mattress. I have been in utter shock. 
“I’m a very heavy sleeper so God knows what would have happened if Matt wasn’t here.” 
The couple said they didn’t consider a low-wattage light to be such a danger – and are urging other parents to make sure lamps in children’s rooms are switched off by the plug. 
Brooque’s bed has been thrown in the bin but her trusty rabbit teddy bear which has been with her since the day she was born survived the ordeal – albeit with a burnt ear. Like us on Facebook
